text: Johann Wilhelm Hittorf (March 27, 1824 – November 28, 1914) was a German physicist who was born in Bonn and died in Münster, Germany. He was the first to compute the electric capacity of charged atoms and molecules (ions). https://www.cambridge.org/core/journals/british-journal-for-the-history-of- science/article/abs/johann-wilhelm-hittorf-and-the-material-culture-of- nineteenthcentury-gas-discharge-research/82D6CB70E783CFF7A993DAFE8219F1F2 Category:1914 deaths Category:1824 births Category:German physicists Category:Scientists from Bonn
title: Johann Wilhelm Hittorf
